content.description: Easy jugs with a layback midway. Don't miss the not so obvious sloper just up right from the second bolt.
content.location: Farthest left climb at the cliff

content.description: The radical-looking line right out the steepest section of the cliff.  Climb the easy slab to a roof,  make 4 boulder moves to victory jugs.  Revenant: a person who has returned, especially supposedly from the dead.Video of the FA

Somewhat interesting climbing getting to the high first bolt. Uncomfortable crystal holds lead up to a small roof. Crank up and over. Unpleasant holds, but the movement is good. Worth doing if you like Bear Rock.
content.protection: 4 bolts. Stick clip the first one.
content.location: Just to the right of Memories.

content.description: Start up to the first bolt after a large ledge, climb past a couple more bolts to a thin face for a couple moves at the top, chains sit just under a roof.
content.location: Left of shit ticket, fifth route from the left end of the cliff.

content.description: Another classic from this area. Is the route to the right of Garbajistan. It has nice big holds but is still quite interesting. There is a "hold" that moves, but does not seem to be going anywhere anytime soon.

Just right of Chosstacular and just left of Double Check.  Stick clip the 1st bolt then proceed up the seam to the second bolt and the business boulder problem using a really nice pocket, crimp, and pinch.  Gain the underclings and then trend left in some jugs and then back right to the 4th and final bolt. From here climb straight up a bulge on crimps where you might kneed to utilize some tricks to gain the anchor.  Sporty up top.  Put a big smile on my face so *** FA 6/22/20
Just right of Symbiotic Seven. Climb up a crack and good edges to the high first bolt, traverse right under the overhang on jugs, and pull the fun bulge. That's it. Short and sweet.
content.protection: Bolts. Long slings optional for rope drag, but not necessary.
content.location: The second route from the left end of the crag.

content.description: An extension to Garbajistan. After the anchors to Garbajistan, trend left and pull a roof with a critical heel hook. 3 bolts leads to a set of chains.

Probably the classic climb from this area. Its to the right of the obvious crack in the middle of the cliff. It has an extension (probably a 5.12) after the anchors where you veer left, past 2 bolts to another set of anchors

climbs.name: Double Check Your Salmon Through Chosstastic Chossmosis.

content.description: From the start of Double Check follow the undercling all the way across Salmon Killer into Chossmosis.  Great big hold climbing the whole way!  Second it to clean.  The crux of Chossmosis at the top is excellent with the moves on big underclings, especially with a pump.

One of the better quality link ups.  On the same level of quality as Color of Aluminum.  Start up Double Check and follow the undercling all the way into the top boulder of Salmon Killer.  Has nice big holds the whole way until the end, but you get a great rest right before that crux.  Super fun.

Scramble up easy rock to reach the crack. Climb the first two bolts of Garbjistan.

 Leave a long sling on the second bolt and follow flakes out left. Undercling and jam to reach the third bolt. Squirrel away some rest, and then launch into the powerful and fun crux sequence through the bulge. After getting established on the bulge, pinch a quartz crystal and crank to eventually grab a jug below the roof. An engaging sequence leads you to a stance and bolted anchor.
content.location: At the center of the cliff below an attractive left-facing, left-arching flake that forms a hand-sized crack.

content.description: A variation/link up of Color of Aluminum.  Both salmon and aluminum have that stunning metallic silver color.  Climb COA through the crux of Double Check.  Instead of clipping the bolt cut left and clip the last bolt of Natural Born.  Finish on that route.
content.location: Color Wall in the center of the cliff.

content.description: A linkage, but the combination of two nice sections of climbing.  Startup the first 3 bolts of Salmon Killer then cut right along the undercling into the crux of Double Check finishing on that route.  Another variation is to finish up on Killing Me (Color of Aluminum Plus, FA Will Cornell) which adds some more small boulder moves.  This climb is unique as it has relatively nice holds but consistent pumpy moves. Video
This route is in the central section of the cliff (to the left of the obvious crack)  and has a high first bolt. It veers left after the second bolt.
Shares the start with Shit Ticket. After the first bolt, move right and up the face to a set of chains.
content.location: Shares start with Shit Ticket and left of Chosstacular

content.description: Goes out the right side of the steep cave on some of the better rock at the cliff.  Climb up jugs to a tricky match and a big pull to a huge hole.  Pull the lip on some smaller crimps and trend-right to the anchor.  Suffers from wetness after rain.  Fun movement and cool holds.
content.location: The right side of the cave.

content.description: Starts just to climbers right of Garbajistan and ends at an anchor under the steepest part of the horizontal roof.  Nice edges and crisp technical movement.  Through the big horizontal roof is project that is still in the works.
This is a nice area with mostly bolted climbs ranging 5-7 to 5.13.
